text: one day a man took his three-year-old to
the grandparents house once inside the
kid looked over at the phone turned to
his dad and said dad why is his phone
attached to the wall with a court his
father answered yeah it is strange and
awkward isn't it he told his childhood
hopefully there would soon be a world
without cords or even batteries the
father in question is one of a team of
researchers at MIT who announced in June
that they had successfully sent energy
from one copper coil to another copper
coil seven feet away wirelessly from
that 7-foot leap they imagined a living
room that charges your cell phone when
you walk in a road that charges the
electric car is driving on it a
pacemaker that never needs a new battery
maybe it's the air quality in Beijing or
the threat of the polar bears extinction
but 2007 it seems has been a time for
new ideas about energy a company called
magento is building a giant floating
wind generator 1,000 feet in the air
where it's always windy all the time
helium inflated the wind turbine looks
like a floating pin wheel in the sky a
kind of rotating Goodyear blimp tethered
to the ground and if you can't squeeze
enough energy out of the air a company
called s RI international is trying to
suck it out of the ocean by capturing
the power of bobbing waves but when it
comes to alternative energy Steve Leroy
has a more dramatic ambition it was
reported this year that he created a
device that generates a field of
lightning and potentially electricity
each 3-foot lightning bolt reportedly
generates enough electricity to
illuminate a 60-watt light bulb for 20
minutes from generation to conservation
UPS the package delivery company has
struck upon a savings bonanza by
removing left-hand turns from its
operations it turns out that if you
multiply a minute saved waiting for your
left hand turn times the price of
gasoline times almost ninety five
thousand cars and trucks you've saved a
whole lot of money for the New York
Times Magazine this has been the urine
ideas 2007
you
